meanings.sent1: She readded her favorite book last night.
meanings.sent2: I readded the instructions to make sure I didn't miss anything.
meanings.sent3: He readded the same page multiple times, thinking it would change.
meanings.sent4: The words on the page readded themselves in her mind long after she closed the book.
meanings.sent5: The student readded the passage until it was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: Past tense of read, meaning to have read again
meanings.sent1: After finishing the novel, she readded it to catch any details she missed.
meanings.sent2: He readded the letter from his grandmother, savoring her words once more.
meanings.sent3: The detective readded the suspect's statement, searching for any inconsistencies.
meanings.sent4: The memories readded themselves in his mind, transporting him back to that moment.
meanings.sent5: She readded the note, hoping to find a hidden message she had overlooked.
